intro: Dontostemon pectinatus var. albiflorus, commonly known as the whiteflowered pectinatus, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive, pectinate leaves. The species belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom during the warmer months. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its ornamental value is primarily due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
